ans.reasoning: The method getElementsByTag(String tagName) is responsible for retrieving elements by their tag name. The test case is checking for elements with the 'style' tag, which is directly related to this method. If this method does not correctly handle the retrieval of elements, it could lead to the test failure.

The method data() is responsible for retrieving the data of the child nodes. Since the test case is asserting the data of the 'style' tag, any issues in this method could lead to incorrect data being returned, causing the test to fail.

The method text() retrieves the text content of the element. The test case is also checking the text content of the 'style' tag. If this method does not return the expected text, it could lead to a test failure.

The method Parser.parse(String html, String baseUri) is responsible for parsing the HTML string into a Document object. If there are issues in parsing the HTML correctly, it could lead to incorrect elements being created or retrieved, which would affect the test results.
